DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether differences in the gene coding for the liver enzyme carboxylesterase 1 (CES1) means differences in the metabolism of two CES1 dependent drugs, enalapril and methylphenidate.
DOC.brief_title: Metabolism of Methylphenidate and Enalapril Based on CES1 Genotype
DOC.criteria: > 18 years old Caucasian Chronic disease (except hay fever and eczema) Pregnancy Smoking High level of alcohol consumption (> 21 units per week for men and 14 for women) Known allergy towards methylphenidate and enalapril Permanent use of medication (contraception ok)
